009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.IJ;
016import ij.gui.Overlay;
017import ij.gui.Roi;
018import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
021
022/**
023 * Defines a subclass of ImageJ's {@link Overlay} class
024 * that accepts elements of a specific type {@link T}.
025 * This (abstract) class cannot be instantiated directly but
026 * is supposed to be used as the superclass for specific
027 * overlay types, e.g., for displaying corners, SIFT markers etc.
028 * In the simplest case, the concrete subclass just needs to implement the method 
029 * {@link #makeRoi(Object)}, which is only concerned with geometry.
030 * Stroke width and color are handled uniformly by this class ({@link CustomOverlay}).
031 * The coordinates of added {@link ShapeRoi} instances are automatically 
032 * shifted by a <strong>half-pixel distance</strong> (0.5, 0.5) 
033 * to display integer points at the associated pixel centers.
034 * <br>
035 * Note: ImageJ draws all ROI types except {@link ShapeRoi} with a half-pixel offset.
036 * This class redefines the methods {@link Overlay#add(Roi)} 
037 * to perform the half-pixel shift.
038 * <br>
039 * TODO: Merge this with {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter} and {@link ColoredStroke} (which is simpler).
040 * <br>
041 * Note: This is experimental code - do NOT rely on it!
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2020/10/04
045 *
046 * @param <T> type of elements allowed to be added to this overlay
047 */
048@Deprecated // replaced by imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter
049public abstract class CustomOverlay<T> extends Overlay {
050        
051        public static Color DefaultStrokeColor = Color.gray;
052        public static double DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.25;
053        
054        private Color strokeColor = DefaultStrokeColor;
055        private double strokeWidth = DefaultStrokeWidth;
056        
057        protected CustomOverlay() {
058        }
059        
060        protected CustomOverlay(Color strokeColor, double strokeWidth) {
061                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
062                this.strokeWidth = strokeWidth;
063        }
064        
065        // -----------------------------------------------------------
066        
067        /**
068         * This method, which must be implemented by any subclass
069         * of {@link CustomOverlay},
070         * defines how an instance of type {@link T} is 
071         * converted to an {@link Roi} object.
072         * Called by {@link #addItem(Object)}.
073         * 
074         * @param item an instance of type {@link T} to be added to the overlay
075         * @return the resulting {@link Roi} object
076         */
077        public abstract Roi makeRoi(T item);
078        
079        // Experimental convenience method to specify color/width individually:
080        public Roi makeRoi(T item, Color strokeColor, double strokeWidth) {
081                Roi roi = makeRoi(item);
082                roi.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
083                roi.setStrokeWidth(strokeWidth);
084                return roi;
085        }
086        
087        
088        // -----------------------------------------------------------
089        
090        @Override  // deactivated method in super class:
091        public void setStrokeColor(Color strokeColor) {
092                IJ.log(CustomOverlay.class.getSimpleName() + ": setStrokeColor() has no effect, use strokeColor()!");
093        }
094        
095        @Override  // deactivated method in super class:
096        public void setStrokeWidth(Double strokeWidth) {
097                IJ.log(CustomOverlay.class.getSimpleName() + ": setStrokeWidth() has no effect, use strokeWidth()!");
098        }
099        
100        // -----------------------------------------------------------
101        
102        /**
103         * Sets the stroke color for all items subsequently added to this overlay.
104         * The stroke color can be changed any time between insertions.
105         * Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with 
106         * the existing {@link Overlay#setStrokeColor(Color)} method,
107         * which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
108         * @param strokeColor the new stroke color to be used
109         */
110        public void strokeColor(Color strokeColor) {
111                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Returns the overlay's current stroke color.
116         * Useful for modifying the value temporarily and then reinstating the
117         * previous value.
118         * @return as described
119         */
120        public Color getStrokeColor() {
121                return this.strokeColor;
122        }
123        
124
125        
126        /**
127         * Sets the stroke width for all items subsequently added to this overlay.
128         * The stroke width can be changed any time between insertions.
129         * Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with 
130         * the existing {@link Overlay#setStrokeWidth(Double)} method,
131         * which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
132         * @param strokeWidth the new stroke width to be used
133         */
134        public void strokeWidth(double strokeWidth) {
135                this.strokeWidth = strokeWidth;
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * Returns the overlay's current stroke width.
140         * Useful for modifying the value temporarily and then reinstating the
141         * previous value.
142         * @return as described
143         */
144        public double getStrokeWidth() {
145                return this.strokeWidth;
146        }
147        
148        // -----------------------------------------------------------
149        
150        /**
151         * Adds an ImageJ {@link Roi} instance to this overlay.
152         * A half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI is of type {@link ShapeRoi}.
153         * Should be used instead of {@link Overlay#add(Roi)}.
154         * 
155         * @param roi the ROI to be added 
156         */
157        public void addRoi(Roi roi) {
158                this.addRoi(roi, false);
159        }
160        
161        
162        /**
163         * Adds an ImageJ {@link Roi} instance to this overlay.
164         * Optionally, a half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI 
165         * is not drawn with a half-pixel shift by ImageJ.
166         * Does not apply the overlay's current stroke width and color settings.
167         * This method should be used instead of {@link Overlay#add(Roi)}.
168         * 
169         * @param roi the ROI to be added 
170         * @param shiftHalfPixel if set true a half-pixel shift is added to each coordinate
171         */
172        public void addRoi(Roi roi, boolean shiftHalfPixel) {
173                //IJ.log(roi.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": " + drawsWithHalfPixelShift(roi));
174                // roi.setDrawOffset(true); // does nothing
175                // add half-pixel shift only to ShapeRoi instances (other ROI types are displayed with offset)
176                if (shiftHalfPixel) { // && !drawsWithHalfPixelShift(roi)) { // && roi instanceof ShapeRoi) {
177                        Rectangle2D r = roi.getFloatBounds();
178                        roi.setLocation(r.getX() + 0.5, r.getY() + 0.5);
179                }
180                super.add(roi);
181    }
182        
183//      /**
184//       * Checks if ImageJ automatically draws the particular roi instance with a half-pixel
185//       * shift or not.
186//       * Note that this is handled inconsistently in ImageJ and probably a bug -
187//       * all roi classes should have the same behavior.
188//       * Known ROI-types that do NOT half-pixel shift are
189//       * {@link ShapeRoi} and certain kinds of 
190//       * {@link Line} (namely {@link Roi.POLYGON}, {@link Roi.FREELINE}, {@link Roi.ANGLE}).
191//       *
192//       * @param roi
193//       * @return
194//       */
195//      public static boolean drawsWithHalfPixelShift(Roi roi) {
196//              return true;
197//              return
198//                      roi instanceof Line ||
199//                      roi instanceof Arrow ||
200//                      roi instanceof PointRoi ||
201//                      roi instanceof PolygonRoi && ((PolygonRoi)roi).getType() == Roi.POLYLINE ||
202//                      roi instanceof PolygonRoi && ((PolygonRoi)roi).getType() == Roi.FREELINE 
203//                      ;
204//      }
205        
206        // -----------------------------------------------------------
207        
208        /**
209         * Adds a single item of type {@link T} to this overlay.
210         * Applies the overlay's current stroke width and color settings.
211         * @param item an instance of type {@link T}
212         */
213        public void addItem(T item) {
214                Roi roi = makeRoi(item);
215                roi.setStrokeWidth(this.strokeWidth);
216                roi.setStrokeColor(this.strokeColor);
217                this.addRoi(roi);
218        }
219        
220        /**
221         * Convenience method.
222         * Adds all items of type {@link T} in the supplied list to this overlay,
223         * using the same graphics (color, stroke width) settings.
224         * @param items a list of instances of type {@link T}
225         */
226        public void addItems(List<T> items) {
227                for(T item : items) {
228                        this.addItem(item);
229                }
230        }
231        
232        // -----------------------------------------------------------
233        
234        public void addToOverlay(Overlay otherOverlay) {
235                Roi[] rois = this.toArray();
236                for (Roi r : rois) {
237                        otherOverlay.add(r);
238                }
239        }
240
241}
